description: Fake news titles often rely on ALL CAPS to grab your attention.
Fake news stories may use punctuation to scandalize or grab your attention.

issue: There are typos or grammar mistakes in this story!
description: Fake news stories are often low-quality and contain typos or errors.
News stories should include a byline that names the author of the story. Be suspicious if an author is missing.

issue: It has a questionable social media account!
description: If a social media account is newly registered or has few followers/posts, it should arouse suspicion…
URLs for fake news sites often try to imitate trusted sources, or may have uncommon endings.
A broken link should raise suspicion…

issue: This is a satirical news site!
description: Satirical news sites may post fake news for humorous purposes. Don’t mistake these for actual news!

issue: This source has a factual reporting score lower than 90!
description: This can give you a good indication of how trustworthy the source is, based on content they’ve published in the past. If the score is low, be careful…
Fake news stories may include images that were manipulated using special software.
Fake news stories may include images that were taken out of context.
Reports from different sources can help you verify the story. What do other sources say?

issue: Nobody else has written about this!
description: If nobody else has written about a story, there’s a higher chance it might be fake.
